intro: Fibigia macroptera, commonly known as the large-fruited fibigia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are fleshy, berry-like structures that contain several seeds. Fibigia macroptera is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
